About Us

FastQC

FastQC is a GalaxyTrakr tool that will take sequencing file input and output data on the quality of that read.

Inputs:fastq, bam, or sam sequencing files

Outputs:One collection each for text and html files containing quality data for each sequence processed. If the inputs were paired-end reads, each forward and reverse file will have a separate quality report.


For the purposes of this tutorial, it is assumed that the user has previously created a history, uploaded fastq or fasta files, and created a paired list of them in GalaxyTrakr. If you have not already done so and would like to learn more about those steps, please visit this tutorial for fastq import and this tutorial for creating a collection of fastq pairs.

While in the history where you have placed your sequencing files, search for FastQC in the Tools search bar in the left pane of the GalaxyTrakr main page. Select the matching tool.

GalaxyTrakr will attempt to autopopulate the list of files to run the tool on from the current history. You have the option of running FastQC on an individual sequencing file (select single dog-eared sheet symbol), multiple sequencing files that have not previously been a collection (select the icon with multiple sheets), and a collection of sequencing files (for instructions on how to make such a collection, visit this tutorial. Note that when the multiple datasets option is used, each sequence to be filtered must be selected as if selecting multiple files in Windows (hold down the ctrl key and click on items in the list individually or hold down the shift key and highlight the last item in a group to be selected).

For the purposes of foodborne illness surveillance, tuning the default options of the tool is not generally advisable. If you have questions about uses of contaminant lists or other options on the FastQC tool page, please contact us.

If you would like an email notification when the tool completes working, toggle the Email notification switch.

Click Execute when you are satisfied with your choices to trigger the tool.

The outputs of the tool can be viewed at two levels:

  • At the raw data level, the quality of each individual forward and reverse read in the browser (by clicking on the eye next to each read's name) or by downloading, by clicking on the name of the read and then clicking on the floppy disk button that appears. This file will be in txt format.
  • Alternatively, a webpage report containing visualizations of the raw data can be found by clicking on #:FastQC on stepname: Web page and navagating to the level of each individual read, clicking on the read name, and clicking on the eye icon beside it. That web page will include the following:
    • Basic Statistics
    • Per base sequence quality
    • Per sequence quality scores
    • Per base sequence content
    • Per base GC content
    • Per sequence GC content
    • Per base N content
    • Sequence Length Distribution
    • Sequence Duplication Levels
    • Overrepresented sequences
    • Kmer Content

Documentation for MLST can be found at these locations:

  • Andrews, S. (n.d.). FastQC A Quality Control tool for High Throughput Sequence Data
  • bio.tools
  • OpenEBench
